title: How should I prepare for the IELTS general training? - Quora

response.answer_text: The same rule is applied i.e. practice. GT is quite different from Academics. You will have similar reading and listening modules. But the speaking and writing module differs. So you need to practice accordingly. Spend more time on practicing speaking and writing modules, but that doesn't means you won't practice the rest. Practice all the modules in a day.Read novels and newspapers to increase vocabulary. Listen to english channels on radio. Practice well, the more you practice, the more chances of getting a good score. All the best.

IELTS general is almost same as IELTS acedemic except some minor format changes. IELTS general is basically for immigration and submitted as a proof of English proficiency for the work permit or for permanent residency. It has four main modules- something which we already know: ReadingWritingSpeakingListeningEach of the skills is tested and you are given a band score on the scale of 0–9. You get a score on the half point increment (e.g. 7.5 or 8.5) If you are interested to take training. You can text me privately on Quora.

Thanks to A2A. Your exam will be more general as compared to technical it will be more easy and less irrelevant topics. You need to concentrate more on reading and writing it’s the hard task that anyone can take. For more general information on tips and preparation check my previous answers. Nabee's answer to Which are the best resources to score 8 band in IELTS? All the best.
